review: Still not great, but better than I remembered from my visits 4+ years ago.  The wait staff is still pretty good.  I think they are trying a bit more with the burgers and the toppings as well.  The burgers are messy, but it is a juiciness now more than just grease.  Then there are the fries while you wait. In my previous review I said their chicken sandwiches were great, but I have to take that back after my last visit.  A portion of it had a consistency like it wasn't fully cooked.  I didn't eat all of it, but I was still nauseated the rest of the night.   One of the new things is a small computer at the table with games and news.  You can play trivia games and such for $3 using this device.  We all carry miniature computers with us stocked with free games and they want us to pay them?  Seriously?  Just not sure what they are thinking with that.  That and it's greasy from all the previous customers - eww.

Nope...nope...nope. It had been a long time since I had been to Red Robin, but when it came to mind tonight I was excited about a nice big burger and those tasty bottomless fries.  I was seated and waited on promptly and given a menu. Since I had been there they've really expanded the menu with seemingly great options, but I was so disappointed.  I got there basic burger with cheese and my husband got the Burnin' Love which have been our go to burgers anytime we've ever dined there. We've always enjoyed those specific burgers and if it ain't broke, don't fix it right? I decided to try the garlic parmesan fries and my husband did the regular to complement our burgers.  My burger had bland meat lacking in a great grilled flavor and it was so soggy I had to eat it with a fork. My fries were an absolute joke (I paid an extra $1.49 for them),they came out soaked in oil that was creating a puddle on my plate and heavy chunks of garlic all over them. My husbands burger had watery salsa making it not very desirable and definitely not what he remembered from before. His regular steak fries were good as they've always been, so a couple of points there.  Our tab ended up being $38 for our two burgers, fries, tea and a limeade. Not a bad price had it been some really great burger and fries, but a terrible price for feeling like you got a Chili's quality meal. Their specialty is burgers, so I would expect something really good and unfortunately that didn't happen.

Pretty boring food for a decent price. To be fair, I don't go for all the fancy add-ons and all of that but it's a basic burger with good fries. I do like the kids meals prices and the bottomless side that is offered with the kids meals. It's nice that they can get "refills" of their salad or fruit or fries. Service is always great but we go here when we are in the area because it's an easy way to get back on the highway and we know the service will be good.

Asked for welldone burger and it was very pink. I had an empty glass for most of my visit. The wait staff was nice and I understand they are busy but the seating area is cramped. The fruit portions are tiny and we never got refills on fries. The receipt didnt print out at the table. What was supposed to be an hour lunch turned into nearly 2. Some people have to go back to work! We cant wait around like the families on Christmas break. This location is also a bit difficult to get to.

This place has the worst service. We've given it several chances because the food (if you get it) is decent. The waiters are rude, and you get ignored. The last time we went, we waited for 15 minutes for someone just to take our drink order before we finally just gave up and went somewhere else. It's not worth the hassle.

My wife and I dined at this location, and we were very disappointed in the service that was provided. We got there around 6PM on a Thursday night, walked up to the hostess desk and requested a table for 2. There were several empty tables in sight, so we were confused at the fact that they told us it would be a 15 minute wait. Bewildered, but excited for the dining experience that we had in store, we asked if we could sit at the bar while we waited. The hostess giggled and said "I don't know." We look at the bar, it's empty. With a confused look, I asked if the bar was open seating, as many if not all bars are in this great country are. She continued to laugh and confirmed that she did not know the answer to what I believe is a very simple question. Confused, we wistfully made our way to the waiting room. During this time we looked on as they sat at least two parties of three, that did not have reservations. Neglected, hungry, and vulnerable we watched on as the host and hostesses strategically negotiated which of the two dozen empty tables they would sit this troublesome party of two. It was like watching two fierce competitors strategically moving their pawns to conquer Magnolia in the board game War. In awe of this overly complicated process, I watched as the hostess drew up what must have been the most complex hypothetical scenario, and concluded that they had found the one and only table for us. We sat down at our destined table only to notice the crunch of glass under our feet. The salt shaker had fallen, and nobody had cleaned it up. Annoyed, I threw some salt over my shoulder for good luck and alerted the waiter.  Finally, it was the moment we've all been waiting for.... the bottomless fries. Well, "bottomless" is somewhat of a deceiving term, as they come in nearly empty baskets with about 7 fries in each basket. Yes, you can request as many as you want, but in order to receive a "normal" portion of fries you have to request like 7 refills. This makes you leave feeling like an Angus Heifer heading to slaughter. The campfire sauce was delightful, and after an amount of refills that is not socially acceptable, we received our main course. My fish and chips were great, but I wish I would have taken them up on the pint recommendation, ole' sport. My wife received the entirely wrong burger, but we didn't want to complain as our frustration was most likely visible. I'm not sure if my wife and I will ever be back, as we coined their new advertising phrase... "Red Robin.... DONE" (instead of yum).

Based on the food, this should be a 1 star review. However, I had the pleasure of meeting the manager, Josh. He definitely values customer satisfaction and will do what he can to ensure customers are happy.
Went there and ordered take out. My Avo-Cobb-O salad didn't come with avocado and the fries were cold. You would think it's automatic to put avocados on this salad. Very disappointing.

What can you really say about a chain? Good food, decent dries. Wish they did more with them, especially if their special seasoning doesn't stick onto them very well. Service is decent. Onion rings are good. Would come back. Just a bit pricey for what it is. Be wary of the long waits during peak times.

I haven't been to a Red Robin in several years. There isn't a reason for that, it's just that Katy and Houston have so many new restaurants popping up all over the place that I sort of forgot about Red Robin. However, my husband was in the mood for a great burger and suggested we have lunch there today, so off we went! And I'm so happy we did! My husband ordered their classic Bacon Cheeseburger with steak fries and I ordered their new Avocado Chicken Wedgie with a side salad. It's a grilled chicken breast wrapped in iceburg lettuce that is stuffed with avocado, bacon, and tomato. Mmmmmmm. Everything was fresh and amazingly delicious. I feel like Red Robin has a lot of healthier options on their menu as compared to a few years ago. I was thoroughly impressed with the food and the service.

Does Red Robin have a bad rep or something? Everyone looks at me like I'm crazy when I say I freaking love Red Robin but I do. I really do! I think their food is so good. And bottom less steak fries? Come on! I guess I can only speak for this particular Red Robin since it's the only one I've been to in years. Sometimes after work I just come here and treat myself.  The waitresses are all very nice and friendly and attentive. My favorite is the one who doubles as a bartender in the afternoons. I think her name is Jennifer maybe? She's from the midwest and very lively and energetic. She makes you feel welcome and like she enjoys talking to customers. Once I was eating here and I wanted a hot fudge sundae which used to be on the menu but isn't anymore, I guess. She made it for me anyway and it was delicious. Reminded me of when I was a kid. Try the poutine fries on their specials menu!

Just had dinner and it was overall a wonderful experience. Justin made a wonderful recognition for the southern burger and oh man did it delight! He was attentive, efficient, and polite. The manager checked on me and the expo refilled my drink. Great team work, well ran restaurant. Yummmmmmmmmm!

4 stars, is quite generous of me actually. I was craving junk, I wanted a burger made from real beef, Red Robin has always been a crowd pleaser coupled with endless steak fries, why not right?!  While my burger was hot and fresh, it the meat it self was almost tasteless, the sesame seed bun took over my bacon cheeseburger with provolone cheese, and the fixings on the side.  I was expecting a juicy cut of meat. I also ordered boneless hot wings, good enough, steak fries were hot, could of used a tad bit more crisp to them, but hey they weren't cold and soggy. The bartender was nice enough, not full of conversation which was fine, but a little pep in her step couldn't have hurt the show.  I wouldn't run back here again, as nothing was memorable, I'm here for work, I prefer not to eat crap, but when in Rome..

This has been a pretty regular place for my family ever since it was built. Their burgers and other items on the menu are good and the service has always been great. The only negative I have is in recent years we have noticed their burger and epecially the fish on their fish and chips get much smaller and smaller without a change in price to reflect that change. As a matter of fact the prices are a bit higher. Just enough that it's easy to miss it if you don't go often enough to know their prices. This is unfortunate because the fish and chips is actually one of our family favorites when we're not in the mood for burgers. When they first opened you got 4 large pieces of fish that were so big that they laid over the bed of fries and covered them. They were so big and delicious. I often couldn't finish them but were a good size for my husband, who eats much bigger portions than I do. Then a couple years ago the fish were cut more narrow but similar in length as in the past. Then they got shorter and shorter over time. Tonight, the fish were cut the smallest I had ever seen them. You can tell they took 2 of what used to be their fish and cut them in half to serve the 4 pieces. I was so disappointed that I mentioned it to our server, who I know has been there for a while because he has served us a number of times. He shrugged his shoulder and said he didn't know they had changed. Oh come on. He's been there long enough to know.... Anyway we won't be considering Red Robin as the top of our list of places to eat out at any more. It will remain a possible choice only if we are in the mood for anything else specifically on their menu. Bye for the time being RR....

This is such a mediocre place I remember when they used to be good but those days have long since passed. The burgers just average to bland. I got the sriracha burger and couldn't even taste the heat. It tasted like a lame burger made at home with American slices cheese melted on top.  They are all about bottomless fries but they are so bland why would you want more.

Had a great experience at this place and I think it was driven by the fact that our server was so amazing. Faith was friendly, talkative (and not in the awkward, please leave me alone so I can eat kind of way), and actually seemed engaged by what we had to say. She kept our drinks always full without us having to ask for refills, she checked in with enough frequency to get us what we needed without becoming too present. If I can get seated at her table always I would come back often.  Started with some pretzel bites with beer cheese and I wasn't impressed. The cheese lacks flavor and the pretzels need more salt.  Out entrees were the BLTA and the Marco Polo. The BLTA was good and had plenty of meat and the bread was fresh. I had never had the Marco Polo and it's a chicken sandwich with aioli, arugula, and bacon and it was delicious. Juicy chicken and flavorful bacon made it all I could have asked for.  The best part is that they set up table top entertainment now that also allows you to order refills, appetizers, and desserts on your own right from your seat. And if you need a distraction you can pay to play trivia or many other games. At the end you can also pay your bill from it and never have to wait on your check to come out again. It's an ingenious idea that needs to catch on everywhere.

Resturant just got renovated and it looks very trendy and nice. All seats are padded, not just booths. It's very clean and the staff is friendly. I always get the bacon guacamole burger and it's cooked perfectly every time. They have the best onion rings I've ever had. I also really enjoy the southwestern salad. The wraps/sandwiches also look appetizing but I can't just not order my favorite burger. It's a bit pricey, but I think it's worth it.

Went on a busy Saturday evening, based on the crowd, we were seated rather quickly.  The food was good, service was ok ... nothing stood out from this visit.  I stop in maybe twice a year, I just personally find RR to be overpriced.
Burger heaven!! No matter what burger you order you will walk out happy, service is ok but burgers are the killer!!

Off all things for me to eat at a hamburger joint, I ventured out and had their Veggie burger. I liked it and today came back again for the same thing. They have a huge selection and will adjust ingredients for the customers.  My favorite server is Eli; does excellent work and has a fun upbeat personality.  The have something new that I like. A small monitor sits on the table. It has a lot of features. My 2 favorites are that I call push a button to call my server and that I can pay here with my credit card. This takes a lot of irritation out of going out to eat

Well, I never got a chance to try their food. I was excited to bring my son here after a movie, but even though there were only three or four other tables and at least three visible staff, we were never asked what we would like to drink, much less what we would like to eat.  Heck, they barely even noticed us waiting to be seated. Had to walk out after being there 20 minutes. Come on management, step it up.

Came here for burgers a couple Friday nights ago. There are tons of different burgers to choose from (as well as salads, wraps, etc) and each comes with bottomless fries. They also offer a variety of buns to substitute at no cost. The Smoke & Pepper (winner of the 2013 Food Network Food & Wine Festival!) was delicious and the Chili Cheeseburger got raving reviews as well. Great family atmosphere & all the staff were very friendly. I'll plan to come back the next time my burger cravings strike again.  PS- there's currently a promotion for 2 salads, burgers, and Cinemark movie tickets for $34

The hubby and I dropped by for lunch on our way back to Austin. We were just craving a good gourmet burger - and got exactly what we asked for. We had a great experience! Our waiter, Gerardo was fantastic! Very personable and accommodating with a great attitude. We had a short stack of their perfectly crispy onion rings and the Burnin' Love burger...it was cooked medium like we asked and very tasty and of course it came with the bottomless fries - which are thick steak cut fries (my absolute fav)! Gerardo had them split it for us since we tend to do smaller portions and even gave us a to go container of fries (perhaps because we never asked for more and they are 'bottomless'). Great experience and if we're in the Katy area again, we'll be back!

First time at a Red Robin and let me tell you, I was pleasantly surprised.  I always expected a fast food-type restaurant, but its more like a Chili's sit-down type place.  If you try their burger, listen to me... Order their "Red Robin burger" that has eggs and bacon on it.  And ADD an extra beef patty.  This burger is freaking delicious as a double stack.  Plus, you get a side order of bottom-less fries.  They bring you a super fresh batch every time!  Reeeeed Robin, yummm..

Food is really good, service is hit and miss. To-go orders are 2 star, there is usually a communication issue between what is ordered over the phone, vs what we actually pickup. We starting just walking in and order at the bar instead, but even that very often is wrong orders. But don't have that problem when you sit in, I guess its the difference in ordering with waiters vs. bartender. But I love their beef gourmet burgers and onion rings!!

I come here all the time and I must say the burgers are great. The service is tip top, the waitress is never asked to refill my drink. They do it without being asked. Reason I why I gave 4 stars rather than 5 is because I ordered a burger that was supposed to be bacon lovers, I forgot the name, I think pig out burger. I only got 2 slices of bacon and barely any bacon aioli sauce. Cmon now! That's ridiculous, I expect the burger overflowing with bacon. But it was a good burger. Just not how I expected it! It's a great family place and they give you unlimited fries:)  They even have some drinks that are bottomless. Like there root beer floats & lemonades. A go to place for sure

What a let down. We came to Katy to go clothes shopping and we always like to eat somewhere new. I was excited about trying Red Robin but our experience was a disappointment. From the host to the checkout process, everything was in slow motion. The burgers were sort of okay but were not really seasoned. Definitely not with the price!! I suffered sticker shock to see four burgers, fries and drinks was $66...before the tip. We all could have had Freddy's (which tastes much better) for a third of the price.

Two stars cause although the food was good.  The service was terrible we went I a Sunday afternoon.  Was not to busy, we got seated immediately by a lady that had a look like someone walked on her grave.   Then we waited literally 10-15 minutes to get someone to take our drinks and order.  May not go back to this location.

we come here because it's not too far from the house.  good experience with the wait staff each time we have came.  we always ask for a basket of fries as appetizer with ranch to start off since the fries are bottomless.  recommending signing up for loyalty card. it's free and u get a free burger for your birthday and I think for every 8 burgers/entrees u get one free. not for certain but still good. gotta love free.  oh ya even the root beer float is bottomless. can't beat ice cream and root beer.

This is my second time to eat at Red Robin in a couple of weeks.  I have to say this place is really good.  Both my wife and I love the bottomless sweet potato fries!  Very tasty!   Our first round of fries were cold but still tasted good.  I told Tiffany and she quickly had another round of fries out to us.   Burgers are also excellent.  Great flavor.  We do bunless burgers so I cannot comment on their buns.   We sat at the bar tonight and we were well taken care off.  I will definitely be back to this place again.

My husband, 3-year-old son and I visited this location today around 2pm after a photo session at the JCPenney directly across from the restaurant. I am 9 months pregnant, was super hungry, had never been to Red Robin and it was right there. So I said why not? We were promptly seated by a nice, attentive hostess who answered my husband's questions about the best/most popular menu items.  Our server, Perry, arrived a few minutes later to take our drink orders and we all asked for lemonades. After the drinks arrived, we decided to order the boneless wings appetizer with buffalo sauce and barbecue sauce on the side.  Perry came back about 15 minutes later to take our entree orders, but didn't mention our appetizer, i.e. "It'll be out soon." As he walked away, I told my husband "I hope he didn't forget our appetizer." Another 10-15 minutes went by before Perry arrived with the wings. Well, I can't say they were worth the wait. There was too much breading so they were a bit hard, and there was an aftertaste as though they had been fried in old oil. The barbecue sauce was just OK, but I really liked the buffalo sauce. Also, the fried potato chips that came with the wings were extremely salty. I was only able to eat one.  Now, here comes the worst part of our dining experience. As I was sipping my strawberry lemonade through a straw, I noticed a strange, pinkish smear on the rim of my glass. For reference, my lips had never touched the glass as I only drink with straws at restaurants. I decided to wipe at the smear with a napkin and it was lipstick! Obviously, it was someone else's, as I had only drank through the straw and I wasn't even wearing any lipstick. I was thoroughly disgusted that I had been served a drink in a dirty glass that clearly hadn't been washed since the previous customer used it. I was shocked. I set the drink aside and waited for Perry. My husband motioned him over a few minutes later, and I told him my glass had lipstick on it as I showed him the smear. All he said was "I'll get you another one" as he grabbed the drink and walked away. At the very least, I expected an apology and an offer to deduct the cost of the drink from our bill. However, I decided to let the situation go as I had already decided I was never coming back. I just wanted to eat my burger and go home.  My husband and I both had the Southern Charm Burger. It was quite good, but a bit small in my opinion considering it cost $14+. Our bill(including the tip) was about $65. I thought our dining experience was overpriced considering the underwhelming appetizer, lipstick-smeared glass, service and the small portions. The next time my family wants burgers, we'll take our money elsewhere.
Wow... Wow... Great service, free fries with burgers (unlimited fries) delicious brugers.

The burger options our endless! Love the swanky decor and strawberry pucker lemonade made them famous per the menu! Kids strawberry lemonade is not bottomless, heads up! Burgers were decent and flavorful! These are pre-fab burgers FYI. Fairly decent service and wide array of spirits to quench your thirst! Will return again. The only reason we didn't rate five stars is because my husband turkey burger was cold. I ordered bun-less burger and it was really good. The bottomless fries are portioned so if you are a fry lover, you will be requesting fries frequently.

I am trying to find the best burger joint in Katy.  Unfortunately, RR does not make the cut.  As you will see in other reviews: "overpriced burgers", and this pretty much sums it up...but do go to RR for a drink. I had the smoke and pepper burger.  The burger was big and juicy.  The bun was not dry.  Delicious...this was a good burger.  It also packs in over 1000 calories, so be prepared.  Note that RR has a list of other items you can substitute for the fries, some with an up-charge, some not.  I had the black beans and they were a good complement to the meal. Our service was good.  Nick answered our questions and kept us happy. There were three people in our party...two burgers, an order of fish tacos, an iced tea and two waters.  $45 seems a little high for what we received.  This place is a great restaurant except for the prices. As noted in other reviews, RR has offered discounts when showing your Cinemark movie tickets, but call ahead to verify. I have been to the bar area at RR in the past, and it is a great place to meet after coming back to the Cinemark park-and-ride after work.  The bartenders are friendly and  drink prices are reasonable.  Appetizer specials are also available. Anyway, for taste, service and cost, I still have not seen a burger joint in the Katy area that compares to Fuddruckers at Katy Mills or Whataburger near Westheimer Parkway/Grand Parkway. To summarize, 5 stars for the bar area, 3 for the restaurant...average 4.

Marlo was very attentive. The food was awesome as always.  This was my second time here at this location.  They were pretty busy but you couldn't tell by the excellent service.  Today I gotten. Freckle lemonade I don't know who made it but it was one of the best I have ever had.  Will be back soon!!! I just left there 12/4 @ 940pm service was horrible it was not busy you would have thought it was lunch or happy hour in there I got gets that were like twice cooked my soup came out 5 minutes before my food that took forever to come out I will try it one more time but will have to go in the day time like I did the last time.
Delicious and consistent with other locations. Service was great, place looked clean, and the bottomless strawberry lemonade still rocks!
Our favorite Red Robin.  The food is always delicious and the service never fails, especially if you are lucky enough to get Brandi!

Our server Sydney was the BEST first time coming here with family and I LOVED IT! She was very attentive, kept eye contact and great attitude made me feel like she was my sister. Thats how personal she made us feel. She really deserve our tip and was very greatful ! Not to mention she had a long day of work and kept a smile and friendly attitude. Sydney if you get to read this, keep up the good work and attitude people look for this type of service thats not given anymore and other restaurants need people like you. Thanks for this experience. GBY!
Horrible service!! The mgr James was the only employee working, at all... Waited for 45 min for two burgers. Watched four families eat, arriving after us. Second Chance blown...

Bottomless steak fries is not enough to make me forget this is an overprice burger joint.  Their was nothing special about the burger, chicken strips of fries I tasted that warrant me spending that type of dough at this place.  Even the ambiance is not enough to make me run back to this place over and over again, to pay those prices.  The food is just okay.  I did not try their shakes, so maybe that is what would make want to keep coming back for more? There is a movie deal that they offer at this location that is pretty much 2 entrees and 2 movie tickets for the theater across the street.  That is at least worth doing.

We visited mid week for an early dinner. The bar tender waited on us was nice. But the food took 45 mins, which would have been understandable during peak hours. Food was OK but we won't be back. We just wish the waitress would have communicated with us about the food delays.

We ate fairly often at the Red Robin in Pharr, Texas (Rio Grande Valley-home) so we've come to expect a certain level of food quality and service. Last night however, we had a terrible experience at this location. Servers, wait staff were all no where to be found, it was as if the Costumers were serving themselves. When my burger arrived, which was wrong from the jump, (asked for the veggies on the side-it didn't arrive that way) it was cold! My husband was "warm" but just barely.  Then, after removing the bun and veggies there was 2 TINY "pieces" of avocado, no complete slices, as if they were left over from someone else's plate. The hamburger patty was all split in half and they'd used to cheese as glue to hold it all together.  My husbands party was even worse. When we spoke with the manager about it he was friendly but made excuses. We won't be going back any time soon!

This is a good place to come with friends or family. We are here often because of the discounts offered when you have one of their frequent buyer cards. The only complaint is that the service is not always consistent. Sometimes you'll get a server who refills your drinks and fries with little prompting, and sometimes it takes a while to get any kind of refills. Overall, this is a place we enjoy going, the food is always good, and can be a really reasonable place to go out and eat.

This is one of our favorite places to grab burgers. Always a nice selection of custom burgers and a great amount of side to choose from as well. The full bar is always a nice addition. Nice place to watch sports and hang out.

OMG this place is off the hook. The service was good and the food was great. This was also our first time at a Red Robin.  I ordered the Buzz mack and cheese burger. I loved it so much I had to order a second one to take home since it is a long drive for us. This was our second trip below. Service was great and the food was hot for the most part. Fries not so much I love steak fries but luke warm fries stink and cold fries suck. Guess that is what ya get with bottomless fries.  The strawberry lemonade was divine. Even with the fries I still give this a 5 star.

I've tried Red Robin before but this one is different. Or maybe my taste buds have changed! Whatever the case.. The food was deliciousss. I couldn't help but eat all my fries AND my boyfriend's fries! lol. I ordered th Our waiter Brandon was having it hard. He had 2 tables and had to take care of the table tops. Don't worry. My boyfriend and I understand your struggle so we don't blame you :) He refilled our drinks and was attentive

Packed on a Sunday afternoon. Super casual. Great for a quick bite to eat. Stick with a burger... I got a salad of all things and regretted it... was hungry in 2 hrs!  Attentive staff and great for families or groups.
Friendly staff and yummy food. We like going here for a cheap date  night! The endless fries are awesome and the burgers and chicken sandwiches are fresh and yummy.

Hostess gives off an unwelcoming negative vibe. Upon ordering, I told the waiter named Perry that I wanted sweet potato fries with my burger. He brings out my burger with seasoned fries, and when a question him about my sweet potato fries, he goes back into the kitchen and brings them to me about 10 mins later. He also handed me my husband's plate and handed my husband my plate, and when he realized his mistake, he just told us to switch plates. How do they expect a good tip, and their customer service is horrible??

Clean restaurant, great service but these have to be the worst tasting burgers (meat) I have ever put in my mouth. Almost had a soy flavor or those cheap burgers you would buy in bulk not knowing any better. There is absolutely no way these are 100 percent beef!  If you like Burger King or the cheap charbroiled flavor, you may like these?  Gross!!!!!
We come here from time to time. Never had a problem with service, so far and the food is always good. Good variety of foods for everyone in the family.  Gotta love bottomless fries. :D

Had lunch there on Saturday, July 2nd. I am always a fan of Red Robin (The Bonzai Burger is great and my favorite). I will continue to be a customer.  The only "complaint" I have is the friendliness of the staff. They weren't rude, and they served us in a timely manner. They just didn't have much of a personality akin to what RR is known for. This is the only reason I would give this location 4 stars. Over all still impressed!

Just had lunch at Red Robin for the first time. Our server, Michele, was awesome. Personable and very helpful. My wife had the chophouse burger. Said it was very good. Fried pickles as a appetizer and they were very good. A rather small order for the price, but tasty and consistent in the cornmeal breaking. I had the bacon cheese burger. It too was very good. The bottomless fries that comes with the burgers are very good too. They offer several variations on home made ketchup. I was not impressed with the spicy smoked pepper and a sweet hot. Neither one was very spicy and definitely not hot. Regular ketchup will do just fine. Iced tea was very good. Clean and crisp tasting. They also offer a bottomless root beer float. Maybe next time. The menu is huge. They offer all kinds of burgers, seafood dishes, wraps, soups and salads. We will go back to try Red Robin again. The food is about 3.5 stars. The pricing is s little pricey for the portion size. Out server made the visit very pleasant. Give overall 5 stars mostly because of Michelle.

We have been here several times for a midday burger. Every time has been delicious, cooked to order. We love the burgers and the onion rings are fantastic. We would go more often if not for the calorie count in the burgers and onion rings. Delicious!

We went there for dinner, the hostess said it would be 5-7 mins and took our name to put on the waiting list. We are waiting to be called for a table for 2 when 2 other people walk in and go to the hostess and are seated right away for a table of 2. We ask about our table and the same hostess that we left our name with 5 mins earlier asked what were we  waiting for. We saw her put our name in their seating system. To be forgotten about especially when you aren't that busy was very unprofessional.  This Red Robins is usually our go to place, but now I will think twice before going there. Needless to say, if this is how your hostess handles people when you are not even busy, then I don't want to know how the rest of your establishment's service will be.

We went there a few nights ago.  Horrible service.  The server forgot to bring the condiments so we finally had to call a manager over after waiting over five minutes.  We were never asked for refills or even if we wanted more French fries for our bottomless French fries we ordered.  The hamburger I had was mediocre and so soggy the bottom bun disintegrated, and the salad my daughter got was mostly iceberg lettuce.  I won't go there again.  We left feeling disappointed and wishing we had gone somewhere else.

Back at it again... Southern Charm Burger with no bun cooked medium...awesome!! Double cheeseburger with pepper jack, pretty solid. Endless fries as always! Tried out the tavern sauce, campfire sauce, and chipotle sauce....all pretty good. A great meal if you just want a decent burger for an affordable price!

Food was good. Wait staff was horrific. Go here if you want to: wait to even have a waiter acknowledge you, wait for food, wait for napkins, wait for refills, not know how the reward system works, not know their shake flavors, and get an attitude. After calling the "manager" over and giving the long list of issues he actually said "so can you tell me where we went wrong" WOW. A different manager came over and wanted to explain why the service was how it was and make excuses. Wouldn't ever go back to this location.

I asked the servicer twice if he could change the tv channel and he said he would get the manager to do it. Well that didn't happen.  My wife order a avocado Cobb salad and there was no avocados in it. We asked the servicer and was told that there was an avocados shortage.  Servicer never asked if we want our drinks or fries refill. The services here suck.

I will not be returning to a red Robbins after my experience here. The restaurant was disgusting, no soap in the bathrooms for customers or staff to wash their hands properly, and there was staff eating in the kitchen and in the restaurant while dealing with customers and handeling their food. I saw a girl eating onion rings in the kitchen, lick her fingers, then proceed to handle a customers burger! So disgusting. Surprised that they are Still open!

Food was mediocre- over cooked burger and kids did not care for their food. They changed the kids menu and perhaps the way it is made. They will be challenged with all the other options around here for families.
Overpriced, underwhelming burgers.  The fries were okay, but not worth coming back for.

We ate at the Katy location last night. This is usually one of our go to restaurants when we all can't agree on where we want to go, but last nights visit was very disappointing.  My daughter and I both ordered the Wedgie Burger after asking our waitress about it.  She told us it was just like any other burger, but instead of being in a bread bun, they used lettuce as the bun, and could be eaten just like a hamburger.  What we were served was not at all as she described.  The burgers were a mess.  My daughter's only had one piece of lettuce. The meat was very thin, and more resembled and tasted like what you would get on a whopper from Burger King.  It was not at all a gourmet burger.  We could not finish them, complained to the waitress, and ended up ordering something else to eat.  When we got our check, we were charged for both burgers.  Rather than cause an issue with our waitress who appeared to be new, we paid the check and left.  When our waitress took our uneaten plates of food back to the manager, he should have removed them from our ticket instead of charging us for the poor quality of food we received. We most likely won't be back.

The service was horrible. The waiter never came around to ask if we needed anything or if our food was ok. He spilled the fries for my sons meal. No biggie. He said I'll get some new ones. Never came back with new ones. Just an all around bad experience. There are way better places to spend your money in Katy. I suggest you do
Another great experience here, Terri (mgr) and our waiter Jordan were very attentive to our Celiac daughter's Gluten Free  needs, and everyone was happy with their choices!

I used to really like Red Robin, but the last time I went there the portions got smaller, the prices went up, and the quality went down. For me, that's the trifecta killer combination that will not bring me back again. We ordered onion rings, fries and burgers and none of it was really any good. The burger was soggy and flavorless, the onion rings were wet with oil and not crispy at all. The fries were just "meh". My whole family was silent while eating this and nobody was having a good time, just picking at their food not really wanting to eat any of it.
I've been to this location a few times. They've gotten my to go order wrong every time!!!! This never happened at the Westpark location.

As their motto being "World's Greatest Gourmet Burger", I don't think it comes anywhere near that.  I had a 15% off deal so I decided to go ahead and use it.  Husband ordered the Blue Ribbon with mac n cheese, and I ordered the Banzai with sweet potato fries.  My husband wasn't that impressed with his burger.  He enjoyed the mac n cheese.  My banzai burger was good, but I think they could revamp on their regular buns.  Seems like just store bought type of sesame buns.  My sweet potato fries were a bit cold and soggy.  I like soggy but not cold.  Nonetheless, I still thoroughly enjoyed them and wanted to get refills on it but didn't.  I do like how they have a shorter version of the onion rings now for only $5... it beats paying $13 when you can never finish it between 2 people!  Onion rings- good.  Average service...average burger.  Nothing to write home about honestly.  I've had better burgers for around $10 elsewhere.

Best burger place in Katy. The selection of burgers is pretty solid and the endless steak fries are great. The menu items are reasonably priced but more expensive then steak and shake. But comparing them to Red Robin is like comparing Fiat to a Ferrari .  Bottom line just go there. You will like what you find.

I want to like this place but they make it so hard. My drink came after my food. The server was at the table next to us 3 times before he comes to see us. Had to wait for seating when we were sat at a table that was open and cleaned since the time we walked in. Last time here

Terrible service. Awful.  We went on a family outing last night. It was the first time for some of us at Red Robin. We got there at around 9:30 pm and our order took more than 1 hour to get to us. When it finally came, everything was cold and tasteless. We approached the manager which he was very unprofessional. When I ask are you the manager? He was like "yes, what's up!?"  I told him about our problem and he was very uninterested in resolving the issue, we suggested that we should have all the orders redone, he said ok and said that it should take 5 minutes to make it again. We had to wait another 20 minutes for our order to get back to us. Overall I would not come back here again. Very unpleasant experience, kitchen staff seemed eager to go home, as the rest of the staff. I would not recommend this place to anybody. For those who had a good experience here, good for you. As for us, we are not happy whatsoever. Not cool Red Robin.

Iffy about the pricing for the quality of food - the Swiss burger and the fries here are just pretty good, but there are a lot of options available! I was attracted at first by people always talking about the burgers and bottomless fries here, but the fries are usually pretty bland. In addition, I would love the option to alter toppings more easily. However, there's still a chance I'll come again and try other options. Great service and friendly staff.

I normally love Red Robin. I always get the same thing (I know, I'm boring but it's what I like), a Royal Red Robin Burger & onion rings w/beer.  Well they all tasted ok, though the burger was way over cooked, but my biggest complaint about this location is that the service is absolutely terrible. From bad hostesses/hosts to slow as molasses wait staff. Only go here if you have plenty of time and don't mind luke-warm food.

Have eaten here several times and found the food to be delicious.  The service is lacking and there are very few patrons to even serve!  Asked for a glass of water with my beer and had to remind the waitress at least three times.  If you opt to take sweet potato fries over the regular fries, there is a $1.50 up-charge.   This is very likely somewhere on the menu but the waiter should inform you of that as a courtesy.  Pricey for the tower of onions.  Nine bucks.  Really?

My go to place for Gluten Free burgers, love this place and I love how seriously they take Gluten Free allergies! They have a separate kitchen, gluten free burger buns, and my food ALWAYS comes out first before anyone else with gloves to avoid cross contamination. LOVE this place!!!

Let me start with the positive. Burgers were great as usual as were the fries. The speckled lemonade was also good.  When we arrived we were led to a table with food and dirty napkins under it, I had to ask for it to be swept up as I'm in a orthotic boot and really didn't want someone's dirty napkin on it. The service was slow, we sat with empty drinks for quite sometime, as well as waited to pay our check. The worst part of our meal was my daughters grilled chicken sticks off the kids menu came out cold, literally cold. The plate was warm, but dirty, it had some white cheese like something stuck to the top of the corner of the plate. It was quite dirty, though dirty dishes are never what you want anywhere. I sent the chicken back and happen to notice it was placed under the heat lamps. When I saw our waitress I asked if they were making new ones or just reheating the old ones. She walked back to the kitchen and then threw them away. If I had not said anything I'm wondering if she would have been served reheated food. The manager brought her the new chicken as well as as the drink we had asked to be refilled 10 minutes earlier. He did not even offer an apology for the food being served cold and on a dirty plate. A simple apology goes a long way in making things better. Needles to say, yet another Katy restaurant my family will not return to for a long time.

After leaving my last review I was contacted by the manager and we talked about our experience. She was very professional and apologized for our bad experience at her location. She asked if we could give them another chance at her service and so we went back and she took care if my wife and I . We had a great experience and the service and food were excellent.  Thanks Terri

I've been here numerous times, and I really like their burgers.  French fries are fantastic, and they are bottomless so you can have as many as you want.  Desserts are really good too. I give them 4 stars because they could improve their customer service with the wait staff.  They had this one waiter for a while that we wouldn't even go in the restaraunt if he was there.  Thankfully I think he is gone.  He hasn't been there the last couple of times we've gone to eat.
These burgers are great, but they aren't cheap. The bottomless fries are a nice perk and quite tasty. If you don't mind spending a few extra bucks on burgers then you'll enjoy it.

Burgers! It's the American way. Good food, bottomless fries - what's not to like? The Royale is deelish - fried egg on a cheese burger rocks the house. Hard.  Might be the best national chain restaurant I've visited. Aimed at kids, but  has a real bar. Not high brow food, but very edible.

I've been here twice now and the service has been quick and friendly. Our server today, Anthony, was especially attentive and personable. The food is great too, especially the tower of onion rings. I'll be back for sure!

Quality burgers that are prepared and made well, bottomless fries is a even better reason to go, as they seem to be pretty fast pace with it also. Have a couple fries left and prepare for another round to be on its way.

This place is great!  Good Tea, Good Burgers, Bottomless Steak Fries.  They are a little pricey for a burger, but they are definitely good!  Lately I have been getting the Ensanada Chicken Platter for a lighter choice that is full of flavor!
Great food! Great service! Our server Marlo was very polite and professional! We will definitely return!

There has been only one time when a batender ignored me sitting, making eye contact, and just ignoring me.   Went in today and it took 5 minutes after sitting at the bar to get a drink, then another person came behind the bar, 15 minutes later asked how I was doing and my reply, " I would like to get something to eat".  After watching the bartender serve the guy I met there for lunch, and all the other customers I determined that he could see that I wpuld not leave a tip so he choose to igmore me completely even after my glass was empty.
Our server, Dora, was great with children, friendly, gave great recommendations. The food was quick and tasty too!

This was my first time here with my family and I enjoyed it very much.  The service was excellent and the food was very tasty.  Reasonably priced too.  My only complaint is I wish they would leave more napkins at the table without having to ask.  The burgers are so juicy we needed more napkins.  Will go back again.
The service was slow and after waiting for half an hour after ordering, our burgers came out and were so so. My husband's order also came out incorrect. We will not be coming back here again.
I went to the Katy Frwy location and ordered a cheese burger that was burnt, fries were not seasoned11.00  horrific lunch
Gross: I had the Prime Rib Dip sandwich it's chemical flavoring bath, was not sufficient to make it edible.  The free fries did not make up for the lousy service either.  RC

You come for the burgers but stay for the fries.  Not the place to come to if you are on a no carb diet.  Kids have fun here, the decor is covered with movie posters.  If you have kids they can grab a balloon on the way out, I know it's just a chain but the burgers are definitely above average and really good for the area
Always have a good time & delicious food at this Red Robin! Friendly & accommodating staff. Lots of fun & a family friendly environment.

Our experience here was pretty typical to the franchise. Our serivec was veey spotty at first but the waiter comped us for our teas to make up for it without having to be asked. The Big Tavern Burger is not as big as it looks. Go for the Prime Chophouse or one of the other larger options.

It's a chain, but I like it. The food is tasty and the service is good. I usually get the boca burger and French fries, and sometimes the fried zuchinni appetizer. The burger and fries are really good, and the fries are "bottomless," so you can always ask for more if you like. The fried zuchinni is REALLY good. That's some of the best fried zuchinni I've ever had, but be aware that it is served really hot. Their iced tea is always fresh, and the servers are there to offer plenty of refills.  On my most recent visit, I ordered the natural burger and didn't realize that didn't come with a Boca patty. I'm a vegetarian, so when I was served a regular burger I was pretty disappointed that I'd be paying for a meal that I couldn't eat. Otoniel was our server, and he was really nice about changing my order, and I appreciated that tremendously. The manager even came out and told us that my food (reorder) would be out shortly. I felt bad because it was my fault, but I really liked that they made sure I had the food I wanted anyway. That's great customer service.  The children have ordered from the children's menu- cheese pizza, grilled cheese and macaroni and cheese. They have been delighted with all three options. You have a choice of a few fruits or French fries with the children's menu items.  Good place. I recommend it!

I can't give stars because there are not any minus stars. There on Feb 7, 3:24 in afternoon. Service was ok but here is the problem. My husband ordered a Stella giant which we were told was 22 oz.  the beer came in a Stella glass which we also have at home (16 oz). He asked the waitress was this 22 oz and she said she did not know so she offered to get manager. The manager was Mike Milligan. My husband asks him if this is a 22 oz Stella and he says ihe believes it is. My husband explains we have same glass and this is not 22 oz and what are we going to be charged for. Mr Milligan says a giant Stella. We tried to explain to him it was 16 oz  . He got smart and rude to my husband and raised his voice . Really. What else are you no be truthful about?  Food was ok but what is really funny is that another restaurant in same area had just hired 2 people from that Red Robin because of Milligan. Out and out lying...yes that's sure how to bring your customers back.  I'm going to tell as many folks as I can about Red Robins care for its   I have the receipt to show he charged us for a Giant Stella and measure the Stella Glass 16 oz. to many places to get a burger here.

Good food, as any Red Robin.  Staff are nice.  For a kid friendly restaurant, however, the hostesses seem confused where to seat parties with more than two children. Our kids love it and there are many selections for them to choose from.  We love the veggie burger, although any of the burgers on the menu can be made with a Boca or Gardenburger patty.  We will come back.

I don't often come here, but they do have a good hawaiian burger.  The pricing, however, is a little high imo.  Service here is usually good, and I love their peach tea.  I'd love to see them do a hawaiian bbq burger.

Lots of fun!  Kids love it.  I think it's a GREAT marketing idea to have "endless" steak fries...I mean, how many potatoes could that cost the company and yet we love to ask for more fries because we can!  Great selection of special burgers!

Modern burger restraurant with friendly staff.The atmosphere is relaxed and causal.  It's a great place to have a quick burger and beer. The burgers are unique, tender and juicy. Portions are big enough to share, my gf and I always do when we go. I've been to two different Red Robin's and I always get the same service.

This place is GREAT! The Loaded Chili Cheese Fries and The Lone Star Burger are finger lickin good. If you love CCFries these will not disappoint at all. And if you like Guac and Salsa on your burger the Lone Star combines the two flavors on the burger in such a way i cant get enough. The Bleu Ribbon Burger on Onion Loaf is amazing as well. I enjoyed the onion loaf so much so, I will request it for all my burgers in the future. I do have one sour note, the Burning Love Burger looks awesome, but it will disappoint, do not order it!...Can't wait to go back

Although the location of this Red Robin is a little hidden, it is still a great place for good food.  Great Burgers and THE BEST fries along with great service makes this one of the place that I like to visit over and over.

I was just really not that impressed with this place. I've done well over my fair share of restaurant-hopping so I know what's out there. And let me say that this place was subpar. Quality of my burger was poor. One of the biggest turn-offs for me in a restaurant is when a waiter seats me at a sticky, dirty table. And that was the case here. Gross! The wait was...a little too long. Made me anxious. I don't recommend it if you're looking for genuinely good food.
I love Red Robin for the great service as well as the great food.  It's burgers, salads and such.

This morning my husband and I made a deal... I would let him skip shopping and errands if he would take me to Red Robin for lunch. Done!! I had the mushroom swiss burger and a diet coke, my husband had the whiskey burger.  We both gobbled it down, as well as our fries.  We were very interested in the ginger bread milk shake and chocolate pie, but too full to stuff anything else in our gullets.
Absolutely love the burgers and steak fries with campfire sauce!  If you're there, definitely get the onion rings!  Really, really good!
Food is alright; not as good as they claim. Service can be a little slow at times, slightly overpriced.
I liked their burger and it was pricy by the time you add other stuff.  The staff was very friendly and fast.
